Package persistance

Interface ConfigDAO

All Known Implementing Classes:
ConfigDDBBDAO
public interface ConfigDAO
Interface used for accessing the user's configuration

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    boolean deleteUserConfig​(java.lang.String nick)
    Deletes the configuration of the specified user
    Config getConfig​(java.lang.String nick)
    Returns the configuration of the specified user
    boolean setConfig​(java.lang.String nick, char[] characters)
    Saves a key configuration for the specified user
    boolean setVolumePiano​(java.lang.String nick, float value)
    Saves a new piano volume at the ddbb
    boolean setVolumeSong​(java.lang.String nick, float value)
    Saves a new song volume at the ddbb

  • Method Details

    • setVolumePiano

      boolean setVolumePiano​(java.lang.String nick, float value)
      Saves a new piano volume at the ddbb
      Parameters:
      nick - Username of the logged user
      value - Value of the new piano volume (1 = full volume, 0 = silent)
      Returns:
      True if the operation was successful

    • setVolumeSong

      boolean setVolumeSong​(java.lang.String nick, float value)
      Saves a new song volume at the ddbb
      Parameters:
      nick - Username of the logged user
      value - Value of the new song volume (1 = full volume, 0 = silent)
      Returns:
      True if the operation was successful

    • getConfig

      Config getConfig​(java.lang.String nick)
      Returns the configuration of the specified user
      Parameters:
      nick - Username of the logged user
      Returns:
      The configuration as a Config object, with the piano volume, song volume and noteBinds

    • setConfig

      boolean setConfig​(java.lang.String nick, char[] characters)
      Saves a key configuration for the specified user
      Parameters:
      nick - Username of the logged user
      characters - Array of characters corresponding to the new configuration,
      Returns:
      True if the operation was successful

    • deleteUserConfig

      boolean deleteUserConfig​(java.lang.String nick)
      Deletes the configuration of the specified user
      Parameters:
      nick - Username of the user
      Returns:
      True if the operation was successful
